Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. arguments.value: Mining: balance i slack to withd
Mining: There is no amount that

deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
By sending Ether, you can lock the contract and get the FLD token.
 The longer the lock period, the more FLD tokens you can take.

By sending erc20 token(_paytoken), _paytoken is locked in the contract. You can get the FLD token.
 The longer the lock period, the more FLD tokens you can take.
Returns true if it is a miningable period.

Calculate the mining rate when locked during the period.
 Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time,
 or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.

When the amount is locked for a period, the amount of mining is calculated.
 Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time,
 or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Mining: There is no amount that can be withdrawn."

documentation.text: After the lock period is over, you can get the Ether or tokens that were locked.
After the lock period expires, you can re-lock the locked Ether or token and get FLD.

documentation.text: Lock the user's token amount until releaseTime

attributes.text:
By sending Ether, you can lock the contract and get the FLD token.
 The longer the lock period, the more FLD tokens you can take.

By sending erc20 token(_paytoken), _paytoken is locked in the contract. You can get the FLD token.
 The longer the lock period, the more FLD tokens you can take.
Returns true if it is a miningable period.

Calculate the mining rate when locked during the period.
 Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time,
 or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.

When the amount is locked for a period, the amount of mining is calculated.
 Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time,
 or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.
After the lock period is over, you can get the Ether or tokens that were locked.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

devdoc.title: Mining Investors can submit Ether or specific tokens to lock them in the contract and mine FLD tokens.

buyToken(uint256).notice: By sending Ether, you can lock the contract and get the FLD token. The longer the lock period, the more FLD tokens you can take.

buyTokens(address,uint256,uint256).notice: By sending erc20 token(_paytoken), _paytoken is locked in the contract. You can get the FLD token. The longer the lock period, the more FLD tokens you can take.

calculateAmountByRatio(uint256,uint256).notice: When the amount is locked for a period, the amount of mining is calculated. Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time, or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.

canWithdrawAmount(address).notice: How much money can be withdrawn

defaultDuration().notice: When only Ether is sent, the mining period is set to this value. When creating a contract, this value is set as the end time-start time.

getAllUserLocks(address).notice: the user funding array currently being managed

getRatio(uint256).notice: Calculate the mining rate when locked during the period. Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time, or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.

getUserLocks(address,uint256).notice: the user funding info of index currently being managed

lengthAllUserLocks(address).notice: length of the user fund array currently being managed

rebuyToken(uint256).notice: After the lock period expires, you can re-lock the locked Ether or token and get FLD.

uintMiningPeriods().notice: When calculating the mining rate with the mining period, this value is used as the unit period if the method of calculating the ratio over time is used.

validPeriod(uint256).notice: Returns true if it is a miningable period.

withdraw().notice: After the lock period is over, you can get the Ether or tokens that were locked.
